meanings.definition: Boldness or rudeness in speech or behavior.
meanings.sent1: Her impudence in class disrupted the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The child's impudence towards the teacher was unacceptable.
meanings.sent3: Despite his impudence, he still managed to make his classmates laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her impudence was like a bright neon sign, impossible to ignore.
meanings.sent5: The impudence of the squirrel stealing food from the picnic basket was comical.

meanings.sent1: His impudence was evident in the way he spoke to his elders.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her impudence and lack of respect.
meanings.sent3: The impudence of the cat demanding treats was both amusing and annoying.
meanings.sent4: The impudence of the storm, daring to disrupt the peaceful night, was unsettling.
meanings.sent5: The impudence of the puppy chewing on the shoes made everyone laugh.

meanings.sent1: The student's impudence in answering back to the teacher was shocking.
meanings.sent2: His impudence in asking for a raise after just a week of work was unbelievable.
meanings.sent3: The impudence of the bird stealing the shiny objects for its nest was quite clever.
meanings.sent4: Her impudence in challenging the authority was like a spark in the room.
meanings.sent5: The impudence of the raccoon raiding the garbage cans was a nightly occurrence.
